author: Anatoly Kurmanaev
title: U.K. Ire at Russia Prompts Focus on London-Based Oligarchs
text:
LONDON—British Prime Minister Theresa May came out swinging last week after a nerve-agent attack on a former spy on British soil, expelling 23 Russian diplomats and saying the U.K. would “freeze Russian state assets” if they posed risks to the life or property of people in Britain.
Mrs. May didn’t mention anything about imposing financial sanctions on Kremlin cronies, some of whom have made London the showplace of their wealth.
